info.name: Label using GPT4o (AI Labeling)
info.description: This block takes all your unlabeled image files, and asks GPT-4o to label them. Your prompt should return a single label, e.g. "Is there a person in this picture? Answer with just 'yes' or 'no'."

parameters.name: OpenAI API Key
parameters.help: An API Key that gives access to OpenAI

parameters.name: Prompt
parameters.value: Is there a person in this picture? Respond only with "yes", "no" or "unsure" if you're not sure.
parameters.help: A prompt asking a question to the LLM. The answer should be a single label.

parameters.name: Disable samples w/ label
parameters.help: If a certain label is output, disable the data item - these are excluded from training.

parameters.name: Image quality

valid.label: Auto, depending on image input size

parameters.help: Whether to send images in low (512x512) or high (using 512x512 tiles) resolution mode. If you don't need high fidelity inference then low-resolution saves a lot of tokens.

parameters.name: Concurrency
parameters.help: Number of samples to label in parallel

parameters.name: Auto-convert videos
parameters.help: If set, all videos are automatically split into individual images before labeling

parameters.name: Extract no. of frames per second
parameters.help: If auto-convert videos is enabled, specify the no. of frames per second to extract from the videos
